bow: baby doll for boy hey there mommit searched and was unable go find thread on this topic so if it was brought up before apologize my month old son became very interested with one of my childhood baby dolls he discovered during our recent move my husband and have no problem whatsoever with his interest in the doll and find it to be normal healthy interest with that aside my dolly is past her prime and worry about her being destroyed or becoming choking hazard so we only have short visits with her and my son loves his play time with her to be honest she has few holes in her stuffing and is kind of creepy looking so would really like to replace the doll with an anatomically accurate baby boy doll for my little man he really enjoys looking at her ears feet hands and eyes and think this could be great developmental tool am interested in your thoughts would you do the same for your son where would be the best place to buy one we want our son to grow up without feeling he must only do boy things but worry family or friends may criticize his having doll thoughts experience in this thanks in advance mommies edit thank you all for your insightful accepting and positive responses really appreciate the advice ideas and perspective am truly overwhelmed and very delighted with the overall positive take on this topic you all seem like fabulous moms definitely do plan to get my boy dolly of his own now no shame thanks ladies maybe not the same but my little brother had cabbage patch doll when we were little we were close in age and he liked to do what did he also played barbies with me let me dress him up and put make up on him had tea parties with me etc he grew up just fine and is into man things like ladies and sports do see the harm in little boys playing with girl toys or little girls playing with boy toys thanks for the response my brothers also played dolls with me some of my fondest childhood memories are of playing dolls and house with my brothers do you think it would be strange to seek out doll for him do most people just wait until sister comes along he my only would take him to the store and let him pick whatever baby doll he wanted good idea thanks deleted the grow up to be good father line is perfect do people comment on your son tea set which sounds absolutely adorable by the way did you purchase it just for him thanks for the link my boys have two baby dolls that my oldest picked out when he was little the younger ones love playing with them and have even given them names ve gotten nothing but praise from friends and family about it they re just regular dolls from the girl section first of all that is super cute my son loves hello kitty so there nothing wrong with what your son likes agree with commenter below me go to the store and let him pick out the one he likes the most that awesome hope my family and friends will be as supportive as yours it so precious he looks at her as though she is real and smiles at her when she is looking at him that really is great idea will have to see how it goes awww that so sweet hate all these gender stereotypes my son is huge woody and buzzlightyear fan but he loves his hello kitty too so do see whats the big deal even if they are ignore their criticism what you re doing is right doll play has been proven to be beneficial for both male and female children this is good article about children and the benefits of doll play http www childcarequarterly com summer04 story1a html my husband and have both decided if we ever had boy he would get dolls we ve been blessed with daughter and another on the way so if we end up with boy by default he ll have plenty of dolls to play with but it works out bc that what we have wanted anyway go you with your progressive parenting if you are wanting to avoid the pink plastic hell that is the girl aisle in the toy store check out etsy there are couple of great waldorf doll makers there who will make dolls custom you could order on that looks like him even thank you for your encouraging words fantastic article ca wait to share it with my husband when he gets home thanks for sharing yes this is my main concern with bringing him to choose one not much variety on those aisles would have problem if he chose pink one but rather there be some diversity the etsy idea is great thanks our son has caillou doll he loves it and we also have no problem with him having his own doll http www toysrus com buy preschool toy figures playsets speciality caillou classic 14 inch doll idca10568 11195843 my daughter got this for her 2nd birthday and my now year old son loves it til staples sells baby dolls my brother played barbies with me as kid too now he heavily tattooed navy mechanic with shaved head and bmx hobby no do think it would be strange at all especially since he already likes the one you have just take him to the toy store and let him pick one he likes lol yeah my brother has quite few tattoos as well and does krav maga jujitzu other mma style fighting for his hobbies he always been the athlete of the family little brothers are cool have such great memories of us playing when we were kids see nothing wrong with boy having baby doll he ll start out just inspecting the anatomy and comparing it to his own and progress to treating it like real baby which is excellent for building empathy and nurturing skills whether to roleplay being father or practice being big brother even if he does end up with pink baby doll you can just call it his baby sister and ca imagine anyone but the most cold hearted having problem with that how cute am happy to hear of all this progressive parenting excited for my boy to grow up amongst well adjusted kiddos agree with this when my daughter said she wanted baby doll ler her pick it out she went for one didnt expect but they have there own personalities my son plays with the dolls sometimes my daughter askesd for dinosaurs this birthday toy are just toys would be too concerned what others think in terms of family they should judge just like you probably would you as mother go with your gut my son loves shoes including my heels he walks pretty good in them for two year old will anything come from it who knows but would love him any less am excited to get him now and am pleasantly surprised with all of the positivity and encouraging posts from you ladies good to hear am very happy with the overall acceptance am seeing in responses hate them too hopefully we can eradicate the stereotypes by starting with our own kids my little brother loved his my buddy doll when he was kid my mom also used the he ll grow up to be good father line whenever someone commented on it he grew up to be great father and grandfather and the favorite uncle in the family he also manly man who likes to crawl around on the floor and play trucks with his granddaughter relevant youtube video sesame street guys and dolls http www youtube com watch v=kxlutl1k8x4 yeah they ve got that and if they say anything just shrug and say what the big deal some people ca let anything go without comment roll your eyes at them it the only way have couple of these in my family my son is months and going to get him doll and stroller when he starts walking consider it standard issue toy for any gender like trucks or sand toys or blocks edit or laugh at them because anyone bothered by something like that is entertaining good old sesame street loved that video hope your brother and men like him share their experiences with younger guys then we could really get somewhere with this gender stigma thing having my mom bring my cabbage patch dolls for my 17 month old son when she comes to visit expecting baby girl in march so thought it would be good thing to use to show him how to use gentle touches etc even if we were having baby though see no problem with letting him play with doll if it what he wants to play with think that is great way to look at it as standard toy it really should be considered standard think have many many people who voice their opinions frequently in my family know some of my family would be down right appalled at the idea of us supplying doll for him but think asking them what the big deal would be great way to either shut them up or open up healthy dialogue good thinking oh wish still had my cabbage patch dolls congrats on your baby girl think that is the perfect way to settle him into the idea of new baby my boy is such people person very social and loves other babies should have been the least bit surprised at his love of baby dolls oh he definitely did he made sure that his own son had whatever toys he wanted including cabbage patch kid and he used the he ll be better father line as well as had my buddy doll when was kid accompanied by an dare you to say something scowl his son grew up to be just like him toy tolerant guess you call it good for him that definitely inspiring could picture my husband daring someone to say something ha agree with others hey so what if he wants doll my daughter plays with boy toys we let her play with whatever interests her my son is into my moms old raggedy ann and andy dolls lately there are no hard plastic eyes or noses so they re safe for him to gnaw on plus when they get gross can just chuck them into the wash my year old son has babies baby tiny is little doll off of target shelf baby effie how he said his own name as baby is corelle tidoo that is hand me down from his sister and seth jr is bitty twin that my parents bought him when we were at an american girl store with my daughter and him he loves them all dearly and they all have their play seth jr had to go to his first weeks of preschool with him as his security my point it does matter what baby you get him he will love them all and practice being daddy with it all of our dolls have soft body and no penises some days they are girls some days they are boys and that ok as very smart friend of mine and father of put it when we discussed this on facebook dolls meaning generic representational human figures are an important learning tool for young boy in very short time he will be faced with number of very daunting learning tasks he has to learn language but that will happen only after he learns the concept of language itself he learning how to be human being doll can help that using the doll to either relive or anticipate situation is valuable tool for him we have set of peanuts dolls he loves linus charlie brown and lucy sometimes they re very nice and plush think my mema picked them up at hallmark store when was pregnant my mom got my older son baby boy doll he was not anatomically correct but he did have clothes that were blue and could be changed do think the diaper actually comes off though was fine with it but my son had no interest in it he picked him up and looked at him every now and then but never really played with him if your son is interested saw why not got my son an anatomically correct male doll corolle brand from amazon com named paul think he loves baby let my son pick out his own doll he now and still plays and cuddles with my old ones as well as couple of his own tell your family to butt out if they try and say anything about him having doll my family got verbal slap to the face when they tried to say anything and they have crossed that line again yet if my son wants pink or barbies then he will get pink and barbies gt my month old son became very interested with one of my childhood baby dolls gt but worry family or friends may criticize his having doll do punish your son not getting him doll because your family friends may be judgmental individuals tell your family friends if they have problem to deal with it get your son doll that being said would get my child an anatomically correct doll at any age or any sex my son got his first doll when he was 15 months old and was month pregnant with his baby sister he stole it from his big sisters room and played with it as if it were real baby in all of the baby stuff we were setting up it helped him bunch when or daughter arrived as he had already practiced being gentle when his baby sister was about 18 months old he put his baby into her bed and insisted that it was hers he great big brother and often plays tea party dress up and gaggles of other things with both of his sister they do the same with him he almost now boys having baby dolls is awesome in my humble opinion family and friends will criticize you no matter what decisions you make people always critique how we raise our kids that just life you get your kid what he wants my brother picked out beautiful baby doll and carried it around forever so true deleted haha lovely have looked everywhere for anatomically correct baby dolls and you found them at staples of all the damn places my situation is kind of the flip side have little girl who for the most part prefers what would be considered boy toys she really into trucks and trains and cars and the like the way see it is that she likes what she likes sometimes that dolls sometimes that trains either way she developing important skills if your son likes dolls he likes dolls he going to like lots of things and those things are going to change often but he kid playtime is important it more important that he has chance to practice and refine the skills he ll get from playtime than what toy he uses if your family does like it they can deal look up waldorf dolls having doll is wonderful idea for little boy it never hurts any human being to learn some nurturing caring empathy and compassion through something like this one of my brothers had doll he loved my mother allowed him to be nurturing and express that it was wonderful learning opportunity waldorf dolls are really wonderful very soft and lovable and they make boys too do little searching and you can find one on etsy too have also seen people making their own so that is an option if you are when was little mom was babysitting at the time and she ended up finding the same doll but boy so she picked it up for him he picked names for both of them was given clothes to dress them in and now they wait for my baby to make an appearance and play with them would have done that for my son had thought about it kind of sad did since it would have been great for learning things one of the ladies
